title: Pair of former Red Sox saves Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts hit a two-run single, giving the Dodgers a 3-0 lead against the Blue Jays in Game 6.
Kiké Hernandez made a crucial defensive play, throwing out a runner to seal the Dodgers' 3-1 win.
The Dodgers forced a Game 7 against the Blue Jays in the World Series with their Game 6 victory.

title: Frights and delights: A look at some of Boston’s stand-out Halloween costumes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: MBTA staff dressed as Wizard of Oz characters and a 'T princess' distributed candy to riders on Halloween.
Jayson Tatum surprised children at Boston Children's Hospital with a visit during Halloween celebrations.
A decorated East Boston home and Fall-O-Ween Festival featured standout costumes and decorations highlighted by Only in Boston.

title: A winning Powerball ticket remains unclaimed in Mass. — and expires next month
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A $50,000 winning Powerball ticket purchased in Marlborough, Mass., remains unclaimed and expires on November 20, 2025.
The ticket, bought at New Capital Farms Convenience Store, matched numbers 16-30-60-62-64 and Powerball 25.
Unclaimed prize money will revert to the state for distribution among Massachusetts' 351 cities and towns after expiration.

title: W. Va. couple had their dream Halloween wedding in Salem
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Thaddeus and Danielle Martin from West Virginia married in Salem Willows Park on Halloween.
The bride wore a black dress and veil, carrying black and red flowers during the ceremony.
The wedding was recorded by Jay Willet of WBZ for radio and television amidst gusty winds.

title: Jaylen Brown continues to shine as Celtics hold off furious 76ers run, win third straight: 9 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored 32 points, leading the Celtics to a 109-108 victory over the 76ers for their third consecutive win.
The Celtics overcame a late rally by the 76ers, holding them off in the final seconds to secure the victory.
The win improves the Celtics' record to .500 for the first time this season, and they're 1-0 in NBA Cup Group B play.

title: Julia Fox defends controversial Jackie O. Halloween costume
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Julia Fox faced backlash for her Halloween costume, resembling Jackie Kennedy's blood-stained 1963 suit.
Kennedy's grandson, Jack Schlossberg, criticized Fox's costume as "disgusting, desperate and dangerous."
Fox defended the outfit, calling it a statement on trauma and resistance, not merely a costume.

title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Falcons' QB Michael Penix Jr. and WR Drake London to start against the Patriots after missing last week's game.
Drake London has tallied 38 receptions on 63 targets, averaging 78.2 yards per game this season.
Patriots' CB Christian Gonzalez has not allowed a touchdown in his last 478 coverage snaps, facing London next.

title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox Chief Baseball Officer Craig Breslow anticipates the team is better positioned to acquire key players this offseason.
Boston made the playoffs for the first time in four years, but faces roster challenges with possible player opt-outs.
The team is $25 million under the first luxury tax threshold and holds a top-rated farm system for potential trades.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel implemented changes to Patriots' pregame introductions, introducing offensive starters individually for the first time in 24 years.
Vrabel emphasizes changes aren't to escape team's past success, but to focus on current competition and improve team performance.
Patriots lead AFC East at 6-2 under Vrabel, despite some initial hiccups with new cultural adjustments and game-day routines.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm will miss ‘a few weeks’, Khusnutdinov promoted to 1C
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm will miss a few weeks due to a lower-body injury sustained during a game against the Buffalo Sabres.
Marat Khusnutdinov will step in as the Boston Bruins' first-line center following Lindholm's injury.
Khusnutdinov, who scored the OT winner against Buffalo, will play alongside David Pastrnak and Morgan Geekie.
